interestingFact: Japan is home to the world's oldest monarchy, with a lineage that dates back over 1,500 years.
Brazil is the largest country in South America and is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
India is the world's largest democracy, with over 1.3 billion people.
France is the world's most visited country, known for its art, culture, and landmarks like the Eiffel Tower.
Egypt is home to the ancient Pyramids of Giza, which are considered one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Australia is the only country that is also a continent, and it has more species of venomous animals than any other place on Earth.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, stretching over 202,080 kilometers.
Italy is known for its rich history, art, and cuisine, and is home to the Vatican City, the world's smallest independent state.
South Korea is known for its rapid technological advancements and is the birthplace of the globally popular K-pop music industry.
The United States is the third-largest country in the world by land area and is a global leader in technology, culture, and economics.
Germany is the birthplace of the automobile and home to the famous brands BMW, Mercedes-Benz, and Volkswagen.
Mexico is home to the ancient Mayan and Aztec civilizations and is known for its vibrant culture, food, and festivals.
Russia is the largest country in the world by land area, spanning over 17 million square kilometers.
The UK is home to the world’s first modern railway, and its monarchy is the oldest in the world, dating back over 1,000 years.
South Africa is known as the 'Rainbow Nation' because of its diverse cultures, languages, and ethnicities, with 11 official languages.
